intro: Malacothamnus palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its dense, golden-yellow inflorescences that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high sunlight exposure. Its leaves are narrow and grayish-green, often covered in a fine layer of white hairs to reduce water loss. Malacothamnus palmeri is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
